column2: Some units are able to adopt different formations that enhance their combat skills on the battlefield.
Locking your ships into a formation ensures that they stay ordered whilst maintaining their spacing.
An army ordered to carry out a forced march gets a significant increase in the action points available to it, but is unable to initiate a battle.
Throughout the campaign you must manage your party’s power in relation to the others.

A military alliance is the strongest bond that can be made between two factions. Both parties swear allegiance to each other, guaranteeing military assistance should either start a war or be attacked themselves.
Battle Advanced
Siege
Satrapies & Client States
Subjects are characters that take part in your faction’s life and politics.
As a general gains experience by leading your armies into battle, his rank and skills develop across three distinct disciplines.
When a new army is raised, you can choose to hand down the legacy of a former army to your newest recruits.
Siege artillery units such as onagers can be recruited in the same manner as other units. However, siege engines are constructed on-site and deployed when assaulting enemy settlements.
By setting camp, your army fortifies itself against attack and defends the surrounding area.
By developing the military chain, new, more advanced units become available.
A cavalry charge into infantry lines can be devastating, but their intervention must be carefully timed to inflict maximum damage on the enemy.
Raiding
Lightly-armoured and armed with swords or spears, medium and light cavalry have good mobility and speed, making them an ideal force to screen and attack from the flanks of their army.
AI Group Control
Trade between regions and other factions is vital to economic development and prosperity.
By moving an army into a settlement, it becomes part of the garrison.
Fortification
Ambush stance immobilises an army but increases its line of sight and makes it invisible to nearby enemy forces.
Confederations
Each faction can unlock generals’ abilities and develop them in-line with skills and experience, sometimes upgrading them to become stronger or affect more units.
Campaign Basics
An overview of some of the more advanced battle controls.
Political Power
In addition to attributes, many units and ships have their own special abilities, that affect a variety of factors such as their morale or the damage they inflict.
Naval Group Formations
You can further invest in your military forces by exploring the training chain in any provincial capital.
Subjects
Legacies
Generals

A province consists of up to four regions, each one containing a settlement. One of these is always the provincial capital, a major, walled settlement, whilst the remainder are minor settlements without defensive walls.
An army besieging a foreign settlement blocks trade income and traps its garrison within.
Assault ships are the frontline of your fleet.
Naval Artillery
Barbarian factions of shared cultural heritage are able to form or join confederations in order to pool their strongest elements for the common good.
Peace Treaties
Ambush
Port
Major & Minor Settlements

Chariots are the tanks of antiquity. Usually comprising of a driver, with at least one passenger armed with bow or javelin, they are best used to either disrupt the enemy’s front ranks prior to an infantry charge or as a skirmishing force.
Spear and pike units are generally best put into tight formations to present a virtually impenetrable barrier.
Agricultural
Transports
Naval Missile
Elephants
Campaign Advanced
A general will often go into battle accompanied by a mounted bodyguard, although some factions can attach them to a unit of powerful, elite infantry instead.
War Co-ordination
Missile troops are excellent skirmishers, peppering the enemy line from a distance to break their formation and create opportunities for heavier infantry to exploit.
Working alongside the heavier assault ships, missile ships are nimble craft with narrow decks that rely on their manoeuvrability and ranged attacks to defeat the enemy.
Land Group Formations

When a faction agrees to become a satrapy or client state to another, it effectively agrees to serve as a subordinate. This means paying regular tribute to new overlords, and in the case of satrapies, breaking all alliances, non-aggression pacts, and military access pacts with other factions.
Spear/Pike Infantry
War can be declared by attacking another faction’s possessions or formally via the diplomatic option.
Unit Formations
Actions
Naval Assault
Capital
Slaves
A peace treaty can be negotiated to formally end the conflict between two warring factions.
Trade Agreements
Battle
The equipment chain improves arms and armour production.
Parties
When an army attempts to cross the sea, a transport ship is automatically supplied to provide passage.
Religious
Chariot
Military Alliance
A defensive alliance is agreed between two factions and pledges allegiance that guarantees support should either faction be attacked.
An overview of some of the more advanced campaign map controls.
Command
Battle Basics
Unit Attributes
Siege Weapons
The core of any army, an attack by highly-trained melee infantry often decides a battle, generally taking place once skirmishing and an initial charge by the frontline spearmen has occurred.
With wide, heavy hulls to support firing platforms, artillery ships carry ballistae and onagers in order to pummel enemy fleets.
City centre buildings may be constructed in provincial capitals, and provide facilities and entertainment for the populace.
Missile Cavalry
Shock Cavalry
Military
Melee Cavalry
Once a group is given over to AI control, they can be given a set of basic instructions, such as attacking a certain unit or defending a specific position.
Garrison
Developing the capital chain allows a settlement to grow in size and stature.
Whilst your armies protect threatened regions, your settlements have their own local garrisons to act as rudimentary defence forces.
Melee Infantry
By mastering the transportation and storage of water, you can develop sewer systems in urban areas and irrigate your crops to significantly increase your wealth from agriculture.

The scale of any victory in battle is measured by the number of casualties suffered by each side. However, in siege, port siege and encampment battles the attacker can capture key positions known as victory points.
Once a trade agreement is in place, a trade route is established between the two, with any ports or settlements along it receiving a share of the income.
An overview of some of basic campaign map controls.
Generals' Abilities
Defensive Alliance
Training
Equipment
When they join you in a war, missions can be offered to all your allies, vassals, satrapies, etc.
Missile Infantry
Religious buildings reflect the part of the gods in the development of their people.
Special Abilities
War
If your party becomes too powerful in a republic, mistrust and paranoia ultimately lead to a challenge for control of your faction. At this point, civil war ensues...
Local Garrison
Trade
Sanitation
Upgrading the port chain enables a province or region capital to specialise in one of the following areas: fishing, trade or navy.
When ordered into a raiding stance, your army draws income from trade routes and nearby settlements.
Technology reflects the advancement of your faction through new ideas and techniques, allowing you to construct advanced buildings, new unit types or greatly improved equipment.
Forced March
Mustering
The agricultural chain enables the construction of food production buildings.
Powerful shock troops, war elephants are one of the most efficient ways of disrupting enemy lines.
Each faction has ultimate objectives that they must complete to achieve victory.
An overview of some of the intermediate battle controls, focusing on better movement for units and armies.
When actively recruiting units into its ranks, an army is said to be “mustering”.
Units and ships have attributes that govern their capabilities in battle, whether they are always active or are triggered in battle under certain conditions.
Your party can gain power by completing missions, winning victories on the battlefield, and through political machinations back home.
Each available formation enables the effective implementation of a tactic, instantly forming your army up to maximise its strengths or exploit a weakness in the enemy.
An overview of some of basic battle controls.
